additionalSection.title: Hairstyle Thickness Chart and Visual Differences
textContent: When discussing hairstyle thickness, it's important to understand how thickness translates to the final look. A thin haircut may appear lighter and have more volume, while thicker haircuts can look fuller and heavier. Below is a simple chart to help you communicate effectively with your barber:

hairTypeTable.care: Very short, bold, almost a shaved look
Short but a little softer than #1
Medium length, good balance for boldness and softness
Longer, fuller look without being too long
Significant length, still a buzz cut, fuller effect
Approaching a short regular cut, still neat
Fullest buzz cut, closest to a regular short haircut

additionalSection.title: How Can I Ensure I Get the Hairstyle I Want?
textContent: To get the hairstyle you want, preparation is key. Before your appointment, use the AI hairstyle changer to visualize different looks and decide on a style. Bring a photo of the style you like to show your barber—this helps avoid any misunderstandings. Clear visual communication is crucial to ensure your barber knows exactly what you want.

Additionally, ask your barber how to maintain your new style and what products to use. Don't forget to ask your barber for styling tips, so you can replicate the look at home. This way, you'll leave the barbershop with the look you desire and the knowledge to keep it fresh.

image.alt: How to ensure perfect hairstyle - communication with barber

additionalSection.title: Fade Hairstyles: Low, Mid, and High Fades
textContent: A fade refers to the gradual transition from short to long hair, and it comes in three common types: low fade, mid fade, and high fade.

• Low Fade: The fade starts just above the ear, creating a subtle and low contrast between short and long hair.
• Mid Fade: The fade begins around the temple area, offering a balanced look.
• High Fade: The fade starts higher up, above the temples, resulting in a sharper contrast and a bold, edgy look.
Each type of fade creates a different effect, so choose the one that complements your style.

image.alt: Fade hairstyles guide - low mid high fade comparison

Your face should be fully visible, and the photo should be taken from the front with no obstructions, such as hats or sunglasses. The clearer the photo, the better the AI can match the hairstyle to your features.
